mappedQuestions.reasoning: Question asks for the primary role of the school psychologist during a crisis event (supporting students/staff and triage, not long-term therapy).
Question asks for the most effective school-wide strategy to reduce bullying (improving school climate/supervision vs. zero tolerance policies).
Question asks to distinguish between a transient threat and a substantive threat in a threat assessment context.
Question asks for the primary goal of postvention services following a student suicide (preventing contagion/clusters).
Question asks to identify common symptoms of trauma in young children (regression, sleep disturbance).
Question asks about the re-entry planning process for a student returning from psychiatric hospitalization (safety planning).
Question asks for best practices regarding crisis drills (they should be practiced regularly and in a developmentally appropriate way).
Question asks to identify the core elements of Psychological First Aid (establish safety, calm, connectedness, self-efficacy, hope).
Question asks specifically about strategies to address cyberbullying (education on digital citizenship).

suggestedNewSkills.name: Bullying & Harassment Prevention
suggestedNewSkills.description: Identify evidence-based strategies for bullying prevention (climate improvement, bystander training) and recognize ineffective ones (zero tolerance, peer mediation for bullying).
suggestedNewSkills.decisionRule: Correct answer prioritizes systemic prevention or bystander intervention; incorrect answers often involve peer mediation (contraindicated) or zero tolerance.

suggestedNewSkills.name: Trauma-Informed Care
suggestedNewSkills.description: Recognize the impact of adverse childhood experiences (ACEs) on learning and behavior, and identify trauma-informed support strategies.
suggestedNewSkills.decisionRule: Correct answer links behavior/symptoms to trauma history or selects interventions that prioritize safety and relationship over punishment.
